alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 9:23AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Marshall and southwestern DeKalb Counties through 1015 AM CDT... At 922 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Crossville, or 8 miles northeast of Boaz, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Boaz, Crossville, Geraldine, McVille, Arona, Painter, Kilpatrick, Rodentown, Whiton and Skirum. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
